intro: Corylopsis gotoana var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy golden bush, is a deciduous shrub native to Japan. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its varietal name "pubescens." It thrives in well-drained soils and partial shade, making it a suitable ornamental plant for gardens. Its ornamental value lies in its vibrant floral display and compact growth habit.
